data.text:
In Robert Mulligan

More popular was Same Time, Next Year (1978), which retained the wistful charm of the Bernard Slade play. Alan Alda and Ellen Burstyn starred as two lovers who meet once a year for almost three decades. Kiss Me Goodbye (1982), however, was a dull romance about a widow…

…appeared in numerous films, including Same Time, Next Year (1978), Crimes and Misdemeanors (1989), Flirting with Disaster (1996), What Women Want (2000), Tower Heist (2011), Wanderlust (2012), The Longest Ride (2015), Bridge of Spies (2015), and

In Ellen Burstyn

…and the film production of Same Time, Next Year (1978). She received an Oscar nomination for Resurrection (1980), in which she played a woman who develops healing powers after a car accident. During the remainder of the 1980s, however, her screen appearances were limited mostly to minor features and television…
